subject: Re: [junit] Re: one time setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: Yes, I would definitely like to see one time setup/teardown become a real feature in JUnit rather than a kludge writing an anonymous class extending TestSetup.
messageBody:
Yes, I would definitely like to see one time
setup/teardown become a real feature in JUnit rather
than a kludge writing an anonymous class extending
TestSetup.
What I don't like about that method is that it locks
me into either doing one time setup or setup for every
little test. I want to make that decision in my test
class and not in the class that runs the suite.

I think one time setup/teardown is appropriate when
you have a static set of data and you are testing
methods that read and write that data in a set way.
For my application, I'm testing database mappings and
a thesarus used in converting individual values. The
source data only needs to be loaded once, not for
every test.

In fact, the more I think about it, I would probably
end up using one time setup/teardown a lot more than
the standard setup/teardown mechanism and it has
nothing to do with how I've factored my application.
So, having either an overloaded setUp/tearDown,
separate set of methods, or a tag interface to allow
one time setup/teardown makes a lot of sense to me.

Curt
--- <jbase@...> wrote:
>
> I have used one time setup and teardown when testing
> tools that work on directories and files. I want a
> know set of directories and files (and for a backup
> tool the dates). I don't see the value in
> setup/teardown for each unit test. This assumes the
> tool/tests do not change the setup.
>
> The only problem was "tricking" junit to allow this.
> I could have done this in ant but sometimes, during
> developement I use jedit and junit and not ant.
>
> I would like junit to support a onetime
> setup/teardown for some types of tools, although it
> is possible I would get lazy and use in when I
> shouldn't.
>
> jeb
